name: Morefield Village Campground

reviews.text: Morefield Campground is located 4 miles into the Mesa Verde National Park. Considering the vast size of this park, if a visitor wants to truly explore the park, it's essential to stay in the park. Otherwise, too much time is spent accessing the park rather than enjoying it.
reviews.title: Best Place to Be in Mesa Verde

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had planned to tent-camp for 2 nights in Morefield. I had been watching the weather, and lows were predicted to be in the upper 40s. Daily highs were expected to hit the mid 70s. This, it seemed, would be perfect weather.
reviews.title: Loved this campground!

likes.liked: — Location, really nice tent sites, proximity to National Park sites
likes.disliked: — Nothing - had a really good experience here

reviews.title: Comvenient
reviews.text: We arrived and were asked to find a site in the front area of the park. (The camping area is divided into 3 main loops--each with smaller associated loops.) We scouted out a nice site, slightly elevated and surrounded by brush. While we could catch a glimpse of nearby sites, it did take some effort to do so. As we entered the campground, we were greeted by dozens of mule deer. Even as we set up camp, several mule deer stopped by to watch.

aka: Morefield Village Campground Hotel Mesa Verde National Park
